name: Il Granaio dei Casabella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in mid-October. Selected this property from Trip Advisor comments and because it was close to the ruins.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean rustic property close to the ruins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very large clean room on the first floor overlooking the beautifully manicured gardens in the back yard. Room also had a separate little enclosed balcony with access to an outside staircase to the ground floor. Both rooms had tiles on the floor. Bathroom was also quite large, shower good pressure. There was no lift and there were 28 steps to the first floor.
reviews.title: Beautiful small country hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was served in a small room attached to the restaurant on the ground floor. Breakfast itself was very poor. Choice from 2 cereals, 2 cakes, sliced bread for toaster, jam, yoghurt, 2 different fruits and some very ordinary fruit juice. There was no cold meat, no cheese, no hard boiled eggs. Actually very little of anything appetising. This was even more disappointing for us as we had eaten both lunch and dinner in the restaurant on the day of our arrival and had been very pleased with the meals. The seafood risotto at lunchtime was very tasty.
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a couple of very large and very tastefully decorated communal rooms on the ground floor with very comfortable lounges. Free wi-fi was available and this worked fine.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.text: There was no safe in the room but to access the property via car or on foot you had to enter via electronic security gates that were operated by the person at the front desk so we were not overly concerned with personal security issues.
reviews.title: wonderful, relaxing atmosphere!

reviews.text: We were so lucky to have found Il Granaio, which was in every way the peak of our three-week trip to Italy! The staff was extremely warm and welcoming. The house has been redone beautifully yet simply and in consistent good taste and is very charming. The garden, where we had tea in the afternoon, and the grounds are lovely. The dinners were wonderfully prepared with all the freshest ingredients and absolutely delicious -- right through to the homemade cannoli (yum). Our room was large and comfortable, with a large bathroom and old-fashioned shudders on the windows. We had a view of the ruins, illuminated at night -- a sight I will never forget. The house is a short walk from the museum and entrance to the ruins. We visited the museum, strolled through the ruins, and had lunch in the garden of the restaurant just outside of the far gate. Perfect. But best of all were the people -- the entire staff of Il Granaio. Thank you all for making our visit so much fun!!! We love you !!! P.S. If traveling by train, it's best to buy a round trip ticket as the Paestum station is always closed.
reviews.title: Piece of Paradise at Paestum ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is wonderfully restored stone barn. Our room was like a room in your well-to-do grandmother's country house if your grandmother had really good taste in furniture. We also had a glassed-in porch all to ourselves. The restaurant was a pleasant room and the other public rooms were so inviting we wished we were planning to stay for a week instead of one day. The Paestum ruins are a 5 minute walk from the hotel, so the location could not be better. Since the hotel is on a side street, it is very quiet, which is no small thing because the road in front of the ruin was a pedestrianized circus on the Sunday when we arrived.
reviews.title: A delightful house in a delightful setting

reviews.text: The people running Il Granaio could not be nicer or more obliging. We were the only guests that evening but they rustled up their excellent cook who provided us with a terrific three course dinner on short notice. Breakfast was much more ample than we could eat, served in a very beautiful glassed-in terrace.
reviews.title: Walk to the Ruins from this Wonderful Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll start with the location:perfect. Right on the main road Via Tavernelle. You buzz the front door and they guide you into the car park.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great staff, great food.

reviews.text: The Innkeeper is a fashionable and pleasant lady who is on top of the place, she "lives" the Innkeeper role and it shows in all aspects of the Inn.
reviews.title: Great Location For Paestum and Agropoli

reviews.text: We had a wonderful 4-nights stay at the Casabella.It is a very quiet, relaxing and unique little hotel with the most helpful and friendliest staff you could wish for. They made us feel at home and treated us like we were part of their family. Joana, "el chefe", Manjeed, Guiseppe and Niccola made our stay a very special one.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Casabella

reviews.text: The Casabella is located about 10 min within walking distance to the ruins of Paestum and about 8 min by car to the beach (go to Lido Athena for sunbeds and umbrellas and also for a good lunch). The sandy beaches and water are very clean just right for a beach vacation.
reviews.title: A real gem of a country getaway in Campania region

reviews.text: Our room was facing the nice and green backyard and had a balcony where we could sit at night. The room had a/c and was very clean.It was really spacious and funished with nice old furniture. We had our dinner every night at the restaurant "Il granaio" downstairs. Your can either order half-board or eat a la carte. Niccola, the chef of the cuisine, created delicious meals with fresh products out of the region. The best was the buffalo filet and as a desert "un tortino chocolate/ a hot chocolate suffle with vanilla ice-cream". In the mornings you could choose from the breakfast buffet with fresh fruits and pastries and Manjeed prepared us yummy cappuchinos. We would definetly recommend staying there and will come back soon again.
reviews.title: Ideal location and very helpful & friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Il Granaio dei Casabella. I had already enjoyed a previous stay when I went there several years back. This time I returned with my good friend and it was a highlight of our trip. If you are looking for a getaway from the maddening crowd of the Amalfi coast, and to be in the heart of buffalo mozzarella country, and just walking distance from the amazing Greek temples of Paestum, then I highly recommend you stay at this hotel. The host Laura and her husband couldn't be nicer. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. The hotel is clean, nicely appointed, and the area is tranquil and safe. The food in their restaurant is excellent and it seems even well-heeled locals do frequent the restaurant, not just hotel guests. I hope to be able to return again very soon. The beach is not very far away, perhaps 2 kilometers from the hotel. A car could be beneficial for this area, as there are numerous places to explore in this region.
reviews.title: Very classy--great place to stay!
Great way to unwind
reviews.text: Lovely hotel with spacious rooms and fantastically helpful & friendly staff. I was going on by bus to meet up with a group and they came to the bus stop to check that everything was OK. Nice restaurant too and good breakfast. Very handy for the temples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have a hotel for the night. We were on our way to see Paestum and passed by this hotel. Since it looked nice and peacefull, we decided to stop and ask for a room. And it worked! The prices were more than good, the service was great, the location was IDEAL (walking distance from the ruins) and the breakfast was good. This is the kind of surprise that we like on a trip!!! I wish anyone who goes there to have the same luck we did.
reviews.title: Got lucky on this one!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had arranged a taxi to meet us at the station and we were given a warm welcome and shown to our large and beautiful room overlooking the garden. That afternoon we walked to the top of the road and as we turned the corner we saw the magnificent Paestum temples. We spent three nights at the hotel and found it to be an oasis of calm. Although the weather was not brilliant while we were there, we really enjoyed our stay. The building is large and beautifully decorated and furnished. We ate at the hotel on the first night and the food was excellent. The breakfast was also good with freshly made cake. There was free wifi in the downstairs rooms. The staff were all extremely pleasant and obliging. They arranged a taxi to take us to the station, helped with the booking of the train to our next destination and even phoned our next hotel and arranged for them to meet us from the station. This is the ideal hotel to stay in to explore the wonderful archaeological site which is a short walk away. Once the tourists have left for the day it is very romantic to wander past the beautiful illuminated temples. Our room as I have said was large and had a sort of conservatory attached and a nice bathroom. The bed was large and comfortable and everywhere was spotless. Our stay in Paestum was the highlight of our Italian holiday, mostly because of the wonders of the place but also because of our restful stay at Il Granaio dei Casabella
reviews.title: An oasis of calm and an ideal base for visiting the wonders of Paestum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really pleasantly surprised. Our rooms, the eating and sitting areas, all were nicer than portrayed on the website, really quite charming. Our room and my sister-in law's room were especially nice, connected, but private. Spacious with really nice bathrooms. We had a small terrace, and from our rooms we could see the Temples lit up at night, just lovely. Our dinner and breakfast was very good. All of the staff were very friendly and smiling.
reviews.title: nicer than the pictures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend staying here if you want to see the Temples. They are truly awesome.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: one night stay but very good location. helpful and friendly staff, very nice atmosphere. food was great, probably one of the best meal we had over our 2 weeks stay in the naples surroundings, definitely THE place to stay when visiting Paestum
reviews.title: This is the Italy we love!!

description: The "Granaio dei Casabella" is an old barn turned into a traditional hotel, which preserved its original charm. It is located next to the Porta Aurea, one of the four gates of the old Paestum city and very close the ruins of the temples. The guest house is situated in a enchanted environment, having a marvelous, colourfull garden, where the guests can admire oleandres, lemon trees, orange trees and other typical mediterranean plants and flours.
